result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:42 a.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek files Victim Impact Statement. Schiek/Shawl/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine - $100 plus costs for a total of $579.00
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:58 a.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher A. Larson
Current: 4241 County Hwy W, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2016)
Prior: 220 Fredrich Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501

1:38 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawl statement that defendant did not receive his letter with court appearance; Shawl- not prepared today for resolution-requests pre-trial conference date. Court questions defendant as to current address - notes that defendant has not kept Clerk informed of current address as required by bond conditions. Court quashes warrant, authorized but not issued. Court reinstates previous bond. Adj. 1:43 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 11:30 am.

1:43 p.m. Attorney Richard John Shawl in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was on calendar for this morning - Shawl statement that he misinformed defendant that hearing was at 1:30 - Defendant does not appear - State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 1:45 p.m.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court with attorney Richard John Shawl. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that negotiations are on-going - close to agreement but no resolution today. Victim is present in court - Schiek motion to modify bond to add No contact with Andrew Boziecevich. Counsel to obtain date from Branch 2 JA. Bail continued. Adj. 2:07 p.m.

3:12 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:13 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:14 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states PD's office contacted Court - defendant is eligible for PD - has not assigned counsel. Bail continued. Adj. 3:14 p.m.

2:26 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Larson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:28 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
